intro: Phyllanthus raivavensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its survival in challenging landscapes.
